content.description:
Pitch 1 : 5.8, four bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with rap rings.  Veer slightly left.

Pitch 2 : 5.4 to fourth class traverse, one bolt and large knobs to tie off to a 2-bolt anchor with rings.  Can be wet and mossy after prolonged rain.

The first pitch is also the approach to the following routes:

- Cool Daze (5.8), cross gully and go straight up

- Adam's Apple (5.9), head up gully to the right
content.protection: 4 quickdraws, several longer slings for knob tie-offs.  60m rope.
content.location:
Third route to the right of Kibbles and Bits, up some third class scrambling.  First bolt is shared with Nipples and Knobs (5.10a).

Descend via rappel.  Probably best to scramble down a bit to the anchor for Rebecca's Sailing (5.9) first.  With a 60m rope, the first rap should get you to the anchor for Kibbles and Bits (5.9).

content.description:
After clipping five bolts on solid rock you will come to a slight overhang.  Clip the sixth bolt and head on up.

You can also take a 5.4 ramp to the right to bypass the overhang -- there is another set of anchors a little ways up and past.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Start from the anchor for Kibbles and Bits.  Descend by rappel.

climbs.name: Once Around the Backside
climbs.fa: Seth Boatright and Chuck Richards April 1972  FFA unknown

content.description: Climb the shallow depression past the bulging crux (photo)  past 4 bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Draws for the 4 protection bolts and two-bolt anchor.
content.location: On the "Back Side" of the Flumes.

climbs.name: Nipples and Knobs
climbs.fa: Danny McKeever, Andy Shillabeer, Eric Ishikawa, 2000

content.description: Start on  the first pitch of Tilting Terrace but go straight upwards after the first bolt. Vertical and slightly overhanging climbing on prominent features. Optional bolt to anchor a belayer on a ledge at the base.
content.protection: Seven bolts and bolted anchor at top with rappel chains.
content.location: Walk up the slab from Jumangi to a small ledge to a bolt. Start is the same as Tilting Terrace but it goes straight up. Descent: rappel the route.

content.description: Lower angle starting right of Titling Terrace on a lower angle spot.  2 bolts to P1 belay at 2 bolt anchor or continue past a bolt into a groove with so-so gear to a second 2 bolt anchor and belay.  P3 Move right to knobs (can be slung for pro) and up to a bolt and then up and left to a hard to see two bolt anchor.  Scramble to the top of the formation and walk off to the west.
content.protection: bolts, gear up to 2" for the groove above the first two-bolt anchor and slings for knobs.
content.location: Right of Tilting Terrace/Nipples and Knobs start

content.description: Fun sport route.  Can be combined with Rebecca's Sailing (5.9) for a second pitch.
content.location: First route to the right of Bits 'n' Pieces.  Starts near a small tree / bush.  Descend by rappel.

content.description: Start in a left leaning flared crack to gain the first  bolt. Leave the crack and climb the face. A bit mossy up top.
content.location: First route uphill from Kibbles and Bits. Can't miss the flared crack start.

content.description: Steep and sustained, but positive holds.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Start from first anchor of Tilting Terrace (5.8) and head up.  Descend by rappel.

climbs.name: Bits and Pieces
climbs.fa: Paul Gagner and Chris Belizzi January 1988

content.description: This is a fun route that climbs up a water streak.  The rock is good and the climbing is fun.  Be aware that there are additional bolts that continue straight up after the 5th bolt.  The rock becomes less stable and the anchor bolts take two ropes to reach the ground.  You are better off traversing right to the three bolt anchor.
content.protection: 5 protection bolts to either a two-bolt or a three-bolt anchor(up and right).
content.location: This is the furthest route to the left on the wall.

content.description: Seven bolts to a 3-bolt anchor (two of the bolts can be used to rappel).  Well-protected crux and good rock.  Can be wet after prolonged rain.
content.protection: Seven draws.  Possibly have a couple of longer ones, since the route wanders a bit.
content.location:
Approach via first pitch of Tilting Terrace (5.8).  Turn to your right and look up the gully.

Descend by rappel.
